reviews.review_text: This is not much of a game and even if this is trying to be a funny April Fools joke on how Indie Devs work... it wasn't funny at all and doesn't really work like it should. Let me explain by telling you the Pro's and Con's.  Pros: ♦ Cheap  ♦ Graphics looks pretty good ♦ Has Steam Trading Cards  Cons: ♦ Game tries way too hard to be funny that it's lame ♦ Game content isn't even long enough to unlock 1 Steam Trading Card ♦ Game crashes if you click the 'Work on the Game' option on Day 1 ♦ Game crashes to Desktop if you finish the game with any option ♦ You can litterally skip everything and get 8 out of 9 achievements in under 1 minute ♦ You can skip every stage of the game and not watch any of it ♦ There is only one playable mode and it's boring as ♦ The main game is soo lame all you have to do is click the corner of a circle that shows in every row of circles (Like it's not even fun or funny, it's just lame) ♦ The ending for developing the indie game and playing through minutes of boringness is soo lame and unfunny ♦ No replay value ♦ Filesize seems like a joke (999.9mb). Feels like they set it to that even though it doesn't have 999.9mb worth of Content anywhere in this game... Only way it could be that big is if it's soo unoptomized it's not funny  In my opinion this game has an awesome concept with high potential with many aspects that could have been forfilled that weren't (Concept seems to be implemented poorly with limited content). Like, there is soo much more the Devs could have done with this to add to the content, the gameplay and even to make it funnier that they didn't even look at. Instead we got a miniscule length game with limited possibilities and unfunny jokes that all end before it even begins.   Therefore, on a whole, I finished this completely by getting all achievements in 11 minutes and the only reason anyone would play longer is if they wanted the Steam Trading Cards. I don't even know why this game has Steam Trading Cards as I don't see how it could even have good emoticons, badges and backgrounds! Also, I found this game extremely unfunny and boring not to mention broken (It shouldn't crash on day one if you try to make the indie game and it shouldn't crash once you finish it). It is one of the shortest, most unfun games I've played in a while and I'd recommend you only ever buy it if it's free or you really had 89 cents you had to get rid of.

There isn’t much of a game here. You watch videos based on your selection and the only interactive parts are choosing what to do and the simplistic game (click on the quadrant of a circle that is in every shape) that you play in order to ‘develop’ your indie game.  You can choose to develop your game or other activities like listening to music, play with your cat or go for a walk. The videos are on the whole fairly well done with good framing and lighting. The best videos are the Creative Commons licensed ones that play whilst you are developing the game. The music consists of many Russian bands/acts that you wouldn’t have heard of unless you are a native. The game has a quirky sense of humour which tends to fall flat. Fortunately, all the videos can be skipped, which is a good metaphor for the game.   You will unlock almost all of the achievements on your first time playing - all of them if you get the good ending. Within half-an-hour you will have seen everything the game has to offer, and there is really no point in playing it again, unless you want the trading cards. In the information about the game in the Steam store, the developer/publisher asks you to “Don't take this game too seriously!” I was sent a key for the game; if you want to pay for it, bear in mind that there is not much game here, seriously.  Review copy provided by Sometimes You.

15 minutes and you're done (not counting grinding for cards and the second ending)... but does that mean it's a bad game? I don't think so, I feel the game set out to tell you one simple thing and it succeeds in this very well.  In order to achieve something (in this case creating an indie game) you need to work hard on it every day. This is the only thing separating the succesful from the unsuccesful.  This isn't a deep thing, but it  is  an important thing. I see no reason not to recommend this game... just don't expect too much.

Well, this game is a bit special. I did like it, the concept and all, but it's way too short, with very little replay values. Also, it's quite repetitive, if you actually decide to work on 'your' indie game. Just like in real life. Just to say, it took me 15 minutes to get everything, and I spent the rest of the total time waiting for Steam Trading Cards.  It's a really simple game. You have a week, a total of 7 actions, which consist pretty much as 'Work on your indie game' or 'Do not work on your indie game'. Obviously, it's not /that/ obvious, but with little to no thinking, it's almost as obvious.  If you decide to work, you get a little puzzle game that's quite simple at first, getting harder day after day. While, if you decide to have fun, you get treated to a short video. Basically, it's 'video or logic game'. You also get to see a video every night.  Thought, I do have to give the game some points, since it gives a great moral lesson: 'You can do everything you want, if you actually spend time towards your goals.' Even if it's repetitive, boring, uninspiring, if you work toward what you want to do, if you work to do what you want, you only need to invest time in it, and eventually, you'll do it. Maybe not in a weekend.  You can actually finish the game in 5 minutes, since the author thought about making a skip video button, which is sometimes a real time saver.  This game is quite original, there's some place for improvements, but it gets bland and repetitive way too soon.  If you're an achievement hunter or someone who wants a really cheap game on steam, this is the game for that.
If you're looking for a fast 9 achievements and another 100% game on your profile, pick this up.  If you're looking for ANYthing other than the above, look someplace else.

as crazy as it may sound... I kind of liked it. I got it for free (and you can too, there is a link for review/press copies in the steam forums for this game) and even if I were to pay a dollar for it, I wouldn't be too mad with what I got. It was a nice little experience. I wish it was a bit longer but still. I enjoyed it. I'm a sucker for artsy kinda stuff like this. The game you play when you're 'making your indie game' is kinda fun, I wish there was some kind of endless mode where it kept track of your score.  overall, Don't buy this if you think this is some cheap alternative to 'Indie Dev Tycoon' DO buy this if you enjoy artsy little experiences. It took me around 15 minutes to get both endings but still. I like it. I may come back to it just to see all the little movies again.
